description: After a tense debate at Bar 101, Sven Halek quietly passes critical information to Vanished organizers on how to bypass BCI tracking and build secure, independent networks.
Vanished citizens stage their dramatic return, openly moving through the city unaffected by BCI scans. Crowds witness their new immunity and word spreads rapidly.
The Vanished establish mutual aid centers, organizing housing, food, and communications for those seeking escape from BCI surveillance. Residents flock to their support.
Ordinary citizens and disillusioned officials secretly approach the Vanished for protection, exchanging resources for sanctuary outside the system. Parallel networks flourish.
Council analysis confirms the Vanished's parallel society is drawing people away from official channels. Internal dissent grows as some officials quietly seek cooperation with the Vanished leaders.
